intro: Gymnadenia × heufleri, commonly known as the hybrid gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodland edges. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display. Due to its hybrid origin, it exhibits a range of morphological variations in its natural habitat.
